document_title: Chronic glomerulonephritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
Chronic glomerulonephritis is a disease that cannot be completely treated because it is also a complication of acute glomerulonephritis. However, the disease can be controlled and symptoms improved by changing nutrition, lifestyle habits and combining with supportive medication.
People with chronic glomerulonephritis need to follow the treatment regimen prescribed by their doctor and have regular check-ups to manage their health and disease progression. Thus, it is possible to maintain stable kidney health and minimize the risk of complications.
